channel.title: Object help [Easy]

item.title: Object help [Easy]
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

[quote=“Epic Steve, post:2, topic:349269”]Find the variable that stores that on load (and save for that matter) then use a simple if statement… Example:

int sara = 13;

if(objectID == 3735 && sara == 15){
    showInterface(16650);
}

Or you could use a nested if statement.

int sara = 13;

if(objectID == 3735) {
    if(sara == 15) {
        showInterface(16650);
    }
}

Hint: Look at your saving and loading methods.[/quote]

Thank you!

Read full topic

item.title: Object help [Easy]
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Steve Epic Steve
item.description:
@Epic_Steve wrote:

Find the variable that stores that on load (and save for that matter) then use a simple if statement… Example:

int sara = 13;

if(objectID == 3735 && sara == 15){
    showInterface(16650);
}

Or you could use a nested if statement.

int sara = 13;

if(objectID == 3735) {
    if(sara == 15) {
        showInterface(16650);
    }
}

Hint: Look at your saving and loading methods.

item.title: Object help [Easy]
item.dc:creator: @4markie 4markie
item.description:
@4markie wrote:

I feel like a noob now. I have no idea how to do this but all I want:

if(objectID == 3735){ showInterface(16650); }
^^^This code tells the object to open interface ID 16650 right? Right now if you click on it, it shows the interface. Done.

But I want it to only show the interface when the value in the character file:

character-saradomin = 0

Is 15

but how would I do this?

Read full topic
